description: House Republicans early Wednesday morning advanced legislation that calls for more than $450 billion to fund the Department of Veterans Affairs, military construction and other programs for fiscal year 2026. The bill advanced out of the GOP-led House Appropriations Committee along party lines, as Democrats came out in strong opposition to the plan. It marks...
title: House GOP advances first 2026 funding bill out of committee

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton said President Trump’s warning to deter protestors from showing up at the Army’s 250th commemoration parade later this week is just talk. “Look, I think that‘s mouth. I mean, this is performance art and he‘s trying to show how tough he is," Bolton said Tuesday during an appearance on...
title: Bolton on Trump warning parade protesters will be 'met with force': 'That's mouth'

author: The Hill Staff
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will testify before the House Ways and Means Committee on Wednesday morning amid trade negotiations following President Trump's sweeping tariffs. The hearing comes after Trump announced early Wednesday that the U.S. and China have reached an agreement that would lower tariffs on U.S. goods to 10 percent and level tariffs of...
title: Watch live: Bessent testifies before House on Treasury priorities

author: The Hill Staff
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chair Dan Caine will testify Tuesday morning before the Senate Appropriations Committee on the Defense Department's fiscal 2026 budget request. The hearing comes as the administration has faced criticism over the deployment of troops to Los Angeles amid protests over local immigration raids. Hegseth testified before...
title: Watch live: Hegseth, Joint Chiefs of Staff chair testify before Senate on Defense budget

author: David Bozell, Opinion Contributor
description: President Trump's rescission package is a necessary step to stop PBS and NPR's abuse of taxpayer funds. Congress must follow through with this reform.
title: Trump, Congress can end abuse of taxpayers by PBS and NPR

author: Sierra Campbell
description: "It comes down to Stockton Rush. The decisions he made led to this," the Netflix documentary director said.
title: Titan submersible documentary director blames implosion on OceanGate CEO

author: Javier Hernandez, Opinion Contributor
description: Puerto Rico needs the power and tools to build a competitive national economy. And that future is already being mapped out by Puerto Rican independence leaders.
title: Puerto Rico doesn't need reshoring — it needs independence

author: Alexis Simendinger
description: In today’s issue:   President Trump flexed his military might against protesters on Tuesday while Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) moved to face off in court against the president’s deployment of National Guard members and Marines in Los Angeles. On the fifth day of controversy sparked by Trump’s immigration policies, the president’s decision to mobilize U.S. troops...
title: Morning Report — Trump vs. Newsom

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Immigration protests in Los Angeles and President Trump's military response are dominating the news cycle, but it's Trump's threat to decimate California's federal funding that has education experts worried.   Golden State schools would be particularly harmed by such a move, advocates say, and in many places, state and local leaders could struggle to make...
title: Amid Trump-Newsom fight, funding threat sends chill through California schools

author: Tobias Burns
description: A proposal in the House version of President Trump's tax and spending cut bill that could levy a 20 percent tax on foreign investors from countries that “discriminate” against the U.S. has foreign governments and financiers worried. Tax experts say the rule is designed to modify a global minimum tax in a way that could...
title: Foreign investors recoil from 'discriminatory' tax in Trump's big bill

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republican senators support President Trump’s crackdown on people protesting his administration’s work to deport thousands of migrants, but they are uncertain about the Pentagon’s deployment of 700 active-duty Marines to California. The Trump White House appears confident that a showdown with California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) over illegal immigration is good politics for the president....
title: GOP backs Trump on LA, but there’s skepticism over deploying Marines

author: Jared Gans
description: Detroit Mayor Mike Duggan is threatening to roil the race to replace Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer (D) as he seeks to boost momentum for his independent campaign. Duggan surprised observers in December when he announced that he would run for governor as an independent instead of as a Democrat, which he had been for his...
title: Independent candidate emerges as wild card in Michigan governor's race

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: As the immigration protests unfolded in Los Angeles, a flurry of misinformation hit social media platforms, sparking further confusion and tension in an already chaotic environment.   The demonstrations and the conflicting accounts surrounding them highlight the role social media plays in times of crisis.   In this case, social media appeared to play an even larger...
title: Misinformation rages as protests roil Los Angeles

author: Joseph Choi
description: A new survey found that a majority of voters are in favor lawmakers and candidates who they believe will take on Big Pharma price-gouging with most saying they're in favor of President Trump's "most favored nation" policy. In a survey commissioned by the Pharmaceutical Reform Alliance and conducted by National Research Inc., 85 percent of...
title: Most voters in favor of Trump's 'most favored nation' drug price policy: survey

author: Brett Samuels
description: Sergio Gor, head of the White House Office of Presidential Personnel, has quietly been at the center of President Trump’s effort to aggressively reshape the size of the federal government and stock it with loyalists. Gor is a lesser-known figure to those outside the Beltway, but sources told The Hill he is a highly influential...
title: Sergio Gor cements himself as 'vital' part of Trump's White House

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump is basking in the U.S. military’s might in light of deploying troops to deal with protests in California ahead of a massive military parade planned in Washington this weekend. Trump on Tuesday visited North Carolina, where he watched military demonstrations and then delivered remarks at Fort Bragg as a precursor to the military...
title: Trump basks in military’s might in wake of California protests, DC parade

author: Jesse Byrnes
description: Elon Musk is voicing regret for his public feud with President Trump, days after an explosive set of public attacks shattered the pair's close alliance. "I regret some of my posts about President @realDonaldTrump last week. They went too far," Musk wrote in an early morning post on his social media platform X on Wednesday. ...
title: Musk voices regret for Trump feud: 'Went too far'

author: Saul Elbein
description: The boom in artificial intelligence (AI) risks filling Texas air with toxins, a report has found. State regulators are considering proposals for more than 100 new gas power projects — the vast majority of them entirely new plants — to power a new wave of data centers, according to findings published early Wednesday by the Environmental Integrity...
title: AI data centers could drive a new wave of Texas air pollution, report finds

author: Tara Suter
description: A judge has rejected California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) emergency request to limit President Trump’s Los Angeles troop deployment. Newsom had earlier Tuesday asked a federal judge to immediately intervene to limit Trump’s deployment of the National Guard in L.A., asking for an emergency ruling by 1 p.m. PDT that day. U.S. District Judge Charles...
title: Judge rejects Newsom's emergency request to limit Trump LA troop deployment

author: Jared Gans
description: The matchup for New Jersey’s gubernatorial race is set, with Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill and Republican Jack Ciattarelli having won their respective nominations Tuesday.  Ciattarelli’s victory, after having won the GOP nomination four years ago and gained President Trump’s coveted endorsement, seemed all but assured heading into the primary. Sherrill was the slight favorite in...
title: 5 takeaways from the New Jersey primaries

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday agreed to let many of President Trump’s sweeping tariffs on United States trade partners remain in effect for now, extending a pause issued late last month after a separate court ruled the tariffs were illegal. The Federal Circuit Court of Appeals granted the Trump administration’s request for a longer...
title: Trump tariffs to remain in place pending appeal, court rules

author: Elvia Limon
description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass in a Tuesday news conference announced she was enacting a curfew for a small part of downtown L.A. as a way "to stop the vandalism, to stop the looting" after five days of protests in response to immigration raids. The curfew covers one square mile and is scheduled to begin...
title: LA mayor announces curfew for part of downtown after days of protests

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Tony Gonzales (R-Texas) on Tuesday called for de-escalation in downtown Los Angeles following the federal troop deployment to quell protests. In an interview on NewsNation’s “The Hill,” the moderate Republican said the massive show of force in L.A. is important to send a message against “lawlessness” in the city but that the situation should...
title: GOP lawmaker presses for de-escalation in LA

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Welcome to The Hill's Defense & NatSec newsletter {beacon} Defense &National Security Defense &National Security   The Big Story  National Guard, Marines deployed to LA come with hefty price tag The Pentagon estimates the deployment of the National Guard and Marines to Los Angeles to quell immigration raid protests will cost about $134 million, and...
title: National Guard, Marines deployed to LA come with hefty price tag

description: Rep. LaMonica McIver (D-N.J.) was indicted Tuesday on federal charges claiming she forcibly impeded and interfered with law enforcement officers after a clash outside an immigration detention facility in Newark on May 9. A press release from the U.S. attorney's office for the District of New Jersey stated that McIver allegedly took such action amid an attempted arrest...
title: McIver indicted on 3 federal charges for 'forcibly impeding' officers at New Jersey immigration center

author: Jared Gans
description: Rep. Mikie Sherrill (D-N.J.) has won the Democratic nomination for governor of New Jersey, coming out on top of a crowded field, according to Decision Desk HQ.  Sherrill defeated five other major candidates for the nomination in a hotly contested primary to succeed two-term Gov. Phil Murphy (D), who is term limited. She entered the...
title: Mikie Sherrill wins Democratic primary in New Jersey governor's race

author: Jared Gans
description: Former state Assembly member Jack Ciattarelli has won the Republican nomination for governor of New Jersey a second time, giving him a chance to get over the finish line after falling short four years ago, according to Decision Desk HQ.  Ciattarelli defeated a few other challengers for the GOP nod, most notably former talk radio...
title: Trump-backed Jack Ciattarelli wins GOP primary for New Jersey governor
